ftbquests.chapter.ae2.quest1739704166994: Create Engineering Processors by merging Diamond, Printed Engineering Circuits, and Redstone in the Inscriber. These processors are needed for powering your most advanced AE2 machines.
ftbquests.chapter.ae2.quest1799359461903: Use the Network Tool to monitor channel usage and power consumption. Perfect for troubleshooting.
ftbquests.chapter.ae2.quest1952369521711: Now that you have crafted your ME Drive, ME Controller, ME Terminal or Crafting Terminal, and Energy Acceptor, it's time to put everything together to build a working AE2 storage system!
-Place the ME Drive and install some storage cells (start with 1k or 4k cells).
-Attach the Energy Acceptor and provide it with power from your energy source to power the network.
-Connect the ME Drive and Energy Acceptor with AE2 cables (Glass, Covered, or Smart).
-Place the ME Controller nearby to manage your network channels.
-Connect the ME Terminal or Crafting Terminal to the network for easy access to stored items.
-Insert storage cells into the ME Drive and start storing your items digitally.
Get Your Digital Storage Up and Running
AE2 Storage Setup: Your First ME Network
ftbquests.chapter.ae2.quest1997580367309: The covered cable variant offers no gameplay benefits over its Fluix ME Glass Cable counterpart. It can however be used as an alternate aesthetic choice if you prefer the covered look.
Can be colored in the same manner as Fluix ME Glass Cable. Four Fluix ME Covered Cable can be crafted with redstone and glowstone to make Fluix ME Dense Covered Cable.
ftbquests.chapter.ae2.quest2126715483918: Applied Energistics is a huge storage mod that will make you replace tom's simple storage for sure!
You can hold "G" to an item to see what it does. Just like create ponder mechanic :D
&8(If you want to contribute like dex, u can always dm me on discord!)
ftbquests.chapter.ae2.quest2142508167502: With the Engineering Press and Diamonds, create Printed Engineering Circuits in the Inscriber. These are crucial for Engineering Processors and high-level AE2 components.
ftbquests.chapter.ae2.quest2181669307610: Make Calculation Processors by combining Pure Certus Quartz Crystal, Printed Calculation Circuits, and Redstone in the Inscriber. Use these for high-level automation, storage cells, and crafting upgrades.
ftbquests.chapter.ae2.quest2261043378105: Other power sources also work with ae2, for example you can use Mekanism windmill to power up your ae2 system which i recommend.
ftbquests.chapter.ae2.quest2298104818936: Create ME Drives and Terminals to start storing items digitally — the core of AE2 storage.
The Drive is the &bdevice&r you plug your &bstorage cells&r into in order to use them for &bnetwork storage&r. It has 10 slots which each accept a cell.
If for some reason you want to, you can push and pull the cells from its inventory with any item logistics like hoppers or ae2 busses.
It can be rotated with a Certus Quartz Wrench.
Your basic terminal, allowing you to view and access the contents of your &bnetwork's storage&r and request things from your &bautocrafting&r setup.
ftbquests.chapter.ae2.quest2397220417098: Create Energy Cells to store power for your network. Dense cells hold more power — perfect for bigger setups.
It works by putting it right next to an Energy Acceptor or connect it via energy cable!
Stores up to 200 kAE amount of energy per cell. Multiple can be placed around the Acceptor
ftbquests.chapter.ae2.quest2892143954533: Use your Charger to turn ordinary Certus Quartz into Charged Certus Quartz — a key ingredient for many AE2 recipes.
ftbquests.chapter.ae2.quest3140823552896: Use the Logic Press to craft Logic Processors, designed for basic computations in your ME system. These are the simplest processors you'll use.
ftbquests.chapter.ae2.quest3558622640082: The quartz fiber is used to share power between networks, while keeping them separate. This allows you to power subnetworks without needing to put energy acceptors and power cables everywhere.
Can be used to keep cables from connecting, although using cables of different colors or using Cable Achor is cheaper
ftbquests.chapter.ae2.quest3729259861008: Craft an AE2 wrench to rotate devices, remove cables, and safely dismantle blocks without losing materials. A must-have as your network grows.
ftbquests.chapter.ae2.quest3790124846999: Craft the Crafting Terminal to craft items anywhere directly from your ME Network.

The Crafting Terminal is similar to a regular terminal, with all the same settings and sections, but with an added crafting grid that will be automatically refilled from &bnetwork storage&r. Be careful when shift-clicking the output!
You should upgrade your terminal into a crafting terminal &l&bASAP&r&r.
ftbquests.chapter.ae2.quest3909775731115: Craft Logic Processors by combining Gold Ingots, Printed Logic Circuits, and Redstone in the Inscriber. Logic Processors are the backbone of basic AE2 machines and automation features.
Simple Automation for Your ME System
ftbquests.chapter.ae2.quest3917466253267: Mostly clear glass made with Certus Quartz Dust. Used to make many AE2 machines and items.
ftbquests.chapter.ae2.quest4406678655915: The Inscriber is where AE2 magic happens — use it with the presses found from meteorites to craft processors and other important parts. Get started crafting the brains of your network.
Same as the Charger, not required to input power via a special AE2 way.
ftbquests.chapter.ae2.quest4715055010789: Charger has multiple uses in the mod, but for now we will use it to make a meteorite compass.
Needs power, but we recently got into the mod.. so we use a &ewooden crank!
Place it on side of a charger and then crank it till it powers up.
&8Wooden cranks will break after some use.
ftbquests.chapter.ae2.quest4737099425343: So, you've started expanding on your network, and you've probably got a handle on resource generation, great, but what next? Setting up auto-crafting is what's next! Auto-crafting is probably one of the most essential parts of the mod and for creating large quantities of items, or any recipe you need.
AE2 Auto-crafting can allow you to request items on demand, keep a certain specific amount of item
in stock, automatically craft items and export them
ftbquests.chapter.ae2.quest4819729306048: With the Calculation Press, create Calculation Processors, essential for performing complex calculations and automation tasks in AE2.
ftbquests.chapter.ae2.quest4879993098379: Use the Logic Press and Gold Ingots in the Inscriber to make Printed Logic Circuits. These are key for building Logic Processors and several important AE2 parts.
ftbquests.chapter.ae2.quest4893395499995: &6Quantum Bridges&r offer a solution to long range, interdimensional networks.
For example, creating a link between the Overworld and the Nether systems, you should link two Quantum Bridges.
They transfer only 32 channels in total, mostly functions as a wireless Dense Cable.
They are constructed of 8 ME Quantum Ring blocks, surrounding one ME Quantum Link Chamber.
ftbquests.chapter.ae2.quest4920834112189: This was the most basic way of explaining Aut-Crafting, it has an monstrous amount of complexity behind it.
There are a few tips I can give you so far:
2. I suggest using Acceleration cards on them, to make them work faster.
3. Many of the components in this quest line have an "Extended" variant, they improve on their original's functionality by storing more, moving more, more jobs and etc.
4. When using the pattern terminal to make patterns, there will be 3 buttons:
- The "X" button - simply clears the pattern
- The Ingot Button - enables / disables Substitutions (for recipes that use items like an Ore Hammer)
- The Bucket Button - will enable / disable using just a fluid instead of a bucket or other item like that
ftbquests.chapter.ae2.quest5468180621682: It is very important to read the guide, since this questline is only touching the basic ground of AE2 and its capabilities!
Feedback appreciated via the discord feedback channel! (tag @!dex)
ftbquests.chapter.ae2.quest5585071810106: The best way to use P2P, is to use them to create, technically, portable Controller Faces. It is important in creating large networks.
Just put them on each side of a controller and use them for machines.
ftbquests.chapter.ae2.quest5760428680603: Use the Silicon Press to create Silicon Presses needed in processor recipes. This press helps you build electronic parts essential for your machines.
ftbquests.chapter.ae2.quest5933569380111: Mine Certus Quartz Crystals and Dust from meteorites.
Be careful to protect budding quartz blocks for an endless resource supply.
&eTip: Use cardboard boxes from Mekanism to move easily
You also have to make some Certus Quartz Dust, either by mining again from budding blocks or putting normal Certus Quartz Crystals in an Inscriber.
Certus Quartz Dust can be used for making Pipes, Quartz Glass or smelted into silicon!
ftbquests.chapter.ae2.quest6475594395096: Use the Calculation Press and Pure Certus Quartz Crystal in the Inscriber to make Printed Calculation Circuits. These form the core of Calculation Processors and automation upgrades.
ftbquests.chapter.ae2.quest6990741778674: Craft the ME Controller — the brain of your ME Network! It manages all connections, controls channel limits, and keeps everything running smoothly. Place it carefully: your network devices connect through it to communicate and function.
- The size of the controller must be within 7x7x7; else it will turn red.
- A controller can have 2 adjacent blocks in at most 1 axis; if a block violates this rule, it will disable and turn red.
Now this one is a bit tough, so stay with me.
The controller is the routing hub of a &bME Network&r. Without it, a network is "ad-hoc" and can only have a max of 8 channel-using &bdevices&r total.
It is not possible to have 2 controllers in one ME Network.
The controller requires 6 AE/t per controller block to function. Each controller block can store 8000 AE, so larger networks might require additional energy storage.
Multiblock Controllers can be built in a fairly free form.
However, there are a few rules that must be followed:
- All controller blocks on a ME Network must be connected; else the blocks will turn red.
Manage and Expand Your AE2 Network
Heart of the Network: ME Controller
ftbquests.chapter.ae2.quest7084932501250: Your AE2 network needs power! Build the Energy Acceptor to connect your system to energy sources and keep everything running smoothly.
ftbquests.chapter.ae2.quest7344227225003: So far, we have set-up a basic AE2 network, maybe not so basic, depends on how you play this mod.

You might realize, by expanding the network, everything is starting to take maybe a little too much channels on the cables? Do not worry! AE2 has a few solutions for this in the form of P2P and Quantum Bridges.

Point to Point tunnels, or P2P Tunnels, act as a way to move a lot of things throughout your network, without interacting with the network directly. That's kind of confusing, so imagine P2P Tunnels as a Portal, connecting two location through the use of Fluix Cabels.
(make sure to also check the AE2 guide for detailed explenation)
ftbquests.chapter.ae2.quest7417154921144: Storage Components are the core of all AE2 cells, determining the capacity of the cells. Each tier increases the capacity by 4x and costs 3 of the previous tier.
Begin by creating the first 1k Storage Component, ideally creating a maxed out 1k Storage Cell ME Drive would currently the best thing.
Storage Cells are one of the primary methods of storage in Applied Energistics. They go in &bME Drives&r or &bME Chests&r.
Storage components can be removed from the housing if the cell is empty by shift-right clicking with the cell in your hand.
The upfront cost of types is such that a cell holding 1 type can hold 2x as much as a cell with all 63 types in use.
ftbquests.chapter.ae2.quest7456974050451: Craft the Meteorite Compass to find meteorites around the world.
Meteorites are how you start the mod, they include essential items!
Dig inside the meteor and break the blocks you find in it.
ftbquests.chapter.ae2.quest7620284836972: While ME networks are also created by adjacent ME-capable machines, cables are the primary way of extending an ME network over larger areas.

&eIf you are new to AE2 and unfamiliar with channels, use smart cable and dense smart cable wherever you can. It will show how channels are routed through your network, making their behavior more understandable.&r

&5Fluix ME Glass Cable&r is the simplest cable to make, transfers power and up to 8 &bchannels&r. It comes in 17 diffrent colors, the default being Fluix, and can be dyed any color using any of the 16 dyes.

To craft colored cables surround a dye of any type with 8 cables of the same type ( color of the cables dosn't matter, but they must be the same type, glass, smart, etc ). You can also paint cables with any forge compatible paint brush in world.
You can craft any colored cable with a water bucket to remove the dye.
You can cover the cable with wool to create Fluix ME Covered Cable, and craft Fluix ME Smart Cable to get a better idea of what is going on with your channels.
ftbquests.chapter.ae2.quest7691112596575: There are two main terminals used for Auto-crafting:

- uses Blank Patterns to create Patterns, most Commonly Crafting and Processing Patterns. Crafting Patterns will go into the providers that connect to your Molecular Assemblers, while Processing Patterns will go to the provider that connects to a machine or other inventory.
- gives you a way to access all providers on your network remotely. It is handy, but only for a lot of providers, not handy when your system is still small
ftbquests.chapter.ae2.quest7691204286744: As you may have guessed, Providers and Assemblers do exactly the same as the name suggests.

When requested, a Pattern Provider will read a pattern inside itself, and push the ingredients written on the pattern into any adjacent inventories. These inventories can be almost anything, allowing for you to create a truly staggering variety of things with your Auto-crafting system.

The Molecular Assembler is the wrokhorse of the Auto-crafting system. Best way to use them is by putting them next to a single Pattern Provider, they are the machines that do the crafting for the system.
ftbquests.chapter.ae2.quest8074363528291: Use the Silicon Press in the Inscriber to make Printed Silicon from Silicon. Printed Silicon is needed in every processor recipe and is a staple item for AE2 crafting.
ftbquests.chapter.ae2.quest8340197904574: Any auto-crafting system requires 3 Main Modules:
Craft Processing Units, The Providers/Assemblers, and the Terminals
Or CPUs, define how large your craft can be, and how many steps can be performed at once. They consist of two parts: Co-processors, and Crafting Storage
The Co-Processor is responsible for telling your network to send more ingredients more often. While technically it is not required, it would be unwise to not have an abundance of these...

The Crafting Storage allows your crafts to be bigger, and contain more steps. Crafting storage blocks use the same ingredients used in storage cells, and can be un-crafted back into their parts by hand
ftbquests.chapter.ae2.quest8359787416767: Through the use of a Memory Card, we can Connect our P2P Tunnels. P2P Tunnels wont work while not configured.
Shift + Right-Click on a P2P Tunnel to create a new frequiency, or copy the existing Frequency if there is one, then Right-Click the P2P end tunnel you want to use to set it's frequency.
&n&6The item will not be lost if used!&r&r
A P2P Tunnel system may have only one input, but as many outputs as the cable you use allow for.
ftbquests.chapter.ae2.quest8774307186711: Make Fluix Dust and Crystals by combining Certus Quartz and Redstone, required by many recipes from now on
ftbquests.chapter.ae2.quest8785375196477: Start with the ME Chest for your first digital storage before advancing to ME Drives.

The ME Chest acts like a miniature network with a ME Terminal, ME Drive, and Energy Acceptor. While it can be used as a tiny storage network, its capacity for just one single storage cell means it has limited utility as such.
ftbquests.chapter.ae2.quest9190921084046: The Quantum Link Chamber has only one slot, for a &6Quantum Entagled Singularity&r.
One is needed for each Link Chamber, however you get 2 from a sigle explosion :)
ftbquests.chapter.ae2.quest9204941404272: The Engineering Press crafts Engineering Processors, used for advanced circuit crafting and powering complex machine operations.
ftbquests.chapter.ae2.quest9619881868418: While bearing some similarity to Fluix ME Covered Cable in appearance, they provide diagnostic function by visualizing the channel usage on the cables, the channels appear as lit colored lines that run along the black stripe on the cables giving you an understanding of how your channels are being used on your network. For regular smart cables, the first four channels show as lines matching the color of the cable, the next four show as white lines. For dense smart cable, each stripe represents 4 channels (will talk further on that later).
On networks with a &bME Controller&r (fruther down the quest line), the lines on the cables show the exact path the channels take.
These can also be colored in the same manner as Fluix ME Glass Cable.
ftbquests.chapter.ae2.quest9811487552720: Higher Capacity cable, can carry 32 &bchannels&r unlike standard cable which can only carry 8, however it &4doesn't support buses&r so you must first step down from dense to a smaller cable (such as Fluix ME Glass Cable or Fluix ME Smart Cable) before using buses or panels. (explained a bit later)
Dense cables slightly override the "shortest path" behavior of channels, channels will take the shortest path to a dense cable, and then the shortest path through that dense cable to a controller.

ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quest21275: The Dominion Wand is used for controlling the creatures you might encounter in the world! Each being responds differently to the wand, so make sure to read up in the Worn Notebook!
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quest24853: In Ars Nouveau, the power system for machines is called &9Source&r.
To start collecting some Source, we'll need a Source Jar.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quest32462: Placing this near growing plants or saplings will provide Source. Archwood trees provide more Source!
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quest34958: The &9Potion Jar&r stores up to 100 potions. You can remove them by using an empty bottle or a potion flask on the jar.
Wixies will use these jars during Potion Autocrafting.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quest35495: The &6Dowsing Rod&r gives you Magic Find and Scrying when used.
This allows you to see nearby magic creatures as well as helping you find amethyst!
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quest44173: There are 3 tiers of glyphs to unlock, and each one requires unique items.
The Scribe's Table can be used as attaching spells to Spell Parchments.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quest44332: The Enchanting Apparatus is used to craft some items.
Use JEI if u wanna know the other items!
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quest46647: The Imbuement Chamber requires Source to imbue items. It produces a small amount of Source by itself, but can also use Source Jars as a power source.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quest47289: The &9Alchemical Sourcelink&r produces Source from adjacent potion jars.
The amount of source varies per potion and complexity.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quest50074: The &9Ritual Brazier&r is used to cast rituals. If you want to light the Brazier, use a Light spell on it.
To perform rituals, you'll need Arcane Pedestals as well. As there are so many rituals to cast, make sure to check out each of them using the Worn Notebook!
This can be done by holding Ctrl on the Ritual Table while the book is in your inventory.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quest58429: With mana, your arrows are now magical arrows!
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quest62979: Source gems are a really important material which can be crafted by using The imbuement chamber!
I don't remember much but lapis works just fine!
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quest66473: Now we can get to making some systems!
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quest67001: Press ''C'' While Holding Your Spellbook. This will open the glyph page, basically creating your own magic.

&eWe all just care about spells right?
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quest72645: This is where you create and store your spells.
Hitting the &eC&r key will open up the spell creation page.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quest77329: Bottom left of your screen, There's the mana bar.

ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quest79302: Ars nouveau is a magic mod that allows you to create your own custom spells!

ftbquests.chapter.bleed_magic.quest15714: Play With Friends - Share Your LP!
Key of Binding lets you share your Life Essence with teammates!
Bind a Key of Binding to your Soul Network
Give the bound key to a friend
They hold it in their offhand or curio slot
Now their sigils and bound items draw from YOUR LP!
Perfect for servers where one player focuses on LP generation while others focus on combat. Power your entire team's sigils, bound weapons, and rituals from a single massive Soul Network!

ftbquests.chapter.composite_materials.qu: The Thumper deals damage based on the distance fallen and negates fall damage.
Basically a better version of the mace.

Similiar attributes to iron, and can repair itself when thrown into water.
End-game tools, has incredibly high attributes and effects.

Similiar to stone tools, but has more durability.

Worse than iron, but can be thrown into water to oxidize the tools, thus making them inflict poison!

When charged, shoots the sonic boom ability from warden.

To use this item, hold it in your main hand and hold a piece of equipment in your off-hand. Right-click to enchant the equipment based on your current XP level. This action costs 3 XP levels and has a chance to yield treasure enchantments.
&8Note: This process does not work with two-handed weapons.
Hold this item in the main hand and hold an enchanted item in the off-hand, right-click to separate the first enchantment of the enchanted item.
To use this item, hold it in your main hand and hold an Enchanted Book in your off-hand. Right-click to duplicate the Enchanted Book.
&8Note: This process does not work with two-handed weapons.
The Sealer heals you for part of the damage dealt, with a chance to drop spawn eggs from the mob.
Echoium Armor set has better attributes than netherite, grants you additional hearts, and grants darkness and blindness immunity!
The Breaker is a special pickaxe that allows you to mine mob spawners.
Makes any item in your off-hand unbreakable.
Can also work just normal as a totem of undying, but with a cooldown instead of breaking.
Fires wither skulls that deal nice amount of damage, can be buffed with full etherite armor set!
The last material to cover is Perkin, made from end-game items.

Hold this item in the main hand and hold the enchanted item in the off-hand, right-click to uprade all enchantments of the enchanted item that do not haffer of maximum level of 1 (Up to an additional 4 levels on top of the maximum, level).
The Opressor heals you whenever a enemy heals near you.
&cThe Elder Guardian&r was once the fierce protector of the ocean, though now it is, simply put, an old fish.
Anyways, we need to kill this boss in order to get a required material.
End-game armor, has incredibly high attributes and effects.
To read all of them, check the item tooltip!
Hold this item in the main hand and hold a piece of enchanted equipment in the off-hand, right-click to transfer all the enchantments to an Enchanted Book.
Composite Materials is a substantial mod that introduces numerous new tools, armor sets, and unique mechanics.
Given the power of the tools obtainable from this mod, this dedicated questline is here to guide your progression.
The armor only provides small amount of armor, but has a lot of armor toughness.
It also gives lot of hp!
If you hit a mob with the bow, then hit another one with the arrow, you can make them fight eachother!
Beheader heals you whenever you kill an enemy with the weapon.
It also has a chance to drop mobs head, increases with every fortune level.
The armor has medium durability but less armor toughness than even diamond.
-It can negate fall damage, give you %%10 move speed with each armor piece.
-You also become immune to wither, poison and hunger damage, recover quickly aswell!
When thrown near an activated conduit, it will turn into a Abyss Fang.
Obtained by killing a Elder Guardian
The last material to cover is Etherite, made from end-game items.
This bow increases it's damage based on how long you draw it.
It can go up to PRETTY high damages, but you have to wait a lot.
These tools deal a lot of damage and still increase with the more hp you got.
The attributes are way higher than netherite, including the durability.
I put this in the last because of how op it can be..
When used it may kill you, but it will duplicate the item in your off-hand.
It can also turn any mob into a egg if below %%1 hp.

It can also upgrade the flint tools we had before into primitive tools!

Worse stats than iron armor, but gives knockback resistance.
This item has two primary functions, depending on its state:
&e1.&r If the book is not enchanted: Right-click to absorb all enchantments from the item held in your off-hand.
&e2.&r If the book is already enchanted: Right-click to consume its durability and release all stored enchantments onto the item held in your off-hand.
In the case of duplicate enchantments during transfer, the one with the highest level will be retained. Note that enchantments can only be transferred to valid equipment.

ftbquests.chapter.create.quest1378992201: The Package Frogport is your automated delivery hub.

ftbquests.chapter.create_connected.quest: The Inverted Clutch does the exact opposite of a normal clutch.
The Inverted Gearshift reverses the input rotation when unpowered and passes it through unchanged when powered, basically opposite of a normal gearshift.
Haunting and Smoking Catalysts channel the Nether’s power-soul fire for spectral conversions, and burning embers for smoke and cooking.
Made from soul sand and netherrack, these catalysts let you tame a darker side of processing.
The Fluid Vessel holds the same amount as a regular tank but in a horizontal layout, ideal for low, wide builds or storage under machines.
Check the ponders, i really can't explain them...
The Item Silo functions like a regular Item Vault but stacks items vertically instead of spreading out. Ideal for compact or tall storage builds.
Charges up with rotational power, then later can be used as a battery!
Two forces, with one goal: better processing.
Blasting Catalysts perform blasting encased fan recipes, while Washing Catalysts perform washing encased fan recipes.
Master them both to expand your automation capabilities.
These clutches engage only under certain conditions, making them ideal for automation based on speed or rotation direction.
Centrifugal Clutch: engages only when input RPM exceeds a set threshold, delaying connection until the system speeds up.
Freewheel Clutch: connects only when spinning in the correct direction, letting you control motion based on rotational flow.
Every upgrade starts somewhere. The Empty Fan Catalyst is the uncharged core-full of potential.
You’ll need it to make all the specialized catalysts that transform your fans into focused processing tools.
To make one of the catalysts below, simply right click the empty catalyst with the proper item in your hand!
Check the Ponder for the Sequenced Pulse Generator to learn more about its advanced redstone logic.
The Shear Pin acts like a regular shaft but breaks instantly if the connected network is overstressed, serving as a failsafe for important components.
The Overstress Clutch disengages automatically with a delay whenever the system becomes overstressed.
The Brake works oppositely: when powered by redstone, it injects massive stress into the system, crashing it instantly.
The Kinetic Bridge lets you transfer Stress Units (SU) from one network to a completely separate Stress Network.
Born from dreams and shaped by extremes-Seething and Freezing Catalysts bring even higher (and lower) temperatures to fan automation.
To view the recipes they can perform, check the uses of the Industrial Fan-which must be used to make these catalysts function.
Create Connected enhances Create with smarter, more versatile components.
Use Fan Catalysts for easier fan processing, specialized clutches and gearboxes to reverse motion, and built-in cogwheels for more efficient machine connections.
Inventory Access Port: connects to a single inventory, allowing direct item insertion or extraction — perfect for compact setups.
Inventory Bridge: links two inventories as one, letting you move items in or out of both using pipes or funnels.

ftbquests.chapter.hexerei.quest185742650: Broom Neterite Tip will allow you to fly through lava and fire without getting damaged!
ftbquests.chapter.hexerei.quest249221264: The mixing cauldron is one of the main tools in hexerei.
Mixing up all sorts of items and potions!
Cauldron can hold items, fluids and these systems integrate with other mods such as create.
It will help us create some items and blocks!
The mixing cauldron when heated can brew up to two buckets worth of potions at a time.
To do this, fill it with water, then add two of the ingredient needed to make the potion!
ftbquests.chapter.hexerei.quest293185180: The pestle and mortar is used for smashing and grinding items to paste.
This will be used for making the blends and pastes for infusing your candles to give them effects!
ftbquests.chapter.hexerei.quest401507470: The coffer is a very useful storage method in hexerei, it uses crows to automate storage!
On the right side of the coffer's GUI is a crow icon.
While toggled, the crow button will allow crows on gather mode to check items inside the coffer and look in the area for items matching its contents to deposit.
Crows with a perch located on a coffer will pick up any item in the area and return it to that coffer!
ftbquests.chapter.hexerei.quest424084369: Courier packages are perfect for sending items to other players or depots.
Delivered by owls, your parcels will always reach their destination!
ftbquests.chapter.hexerei.quest469193980: Packing peanuts are not only perfect for cushioning your Courier packages, but also make for a delightful light snack!
ftbquests.chapter.hexerei.quest470876557: The broom seat is a mix between a satchel and a cosmetic seat, making the rider face forwards.
ftbquests.chapter.hexerei.quest487190665: Broom whistle is a handy tool for any witch.
Bind it to your broom and with a simple blow, your broom will come flying to you!
ftbquests.chapter.hexerei.quest492679578: The Crow can be tamed with a seed mixture.
&8If you throw the mixture to ground you have lower chance of taming them than giving them by hand.
Once tamed crows can be set to different commands.
The player can change these commands by simply right-clicking the crow!
Crows contain 3 slots that are Hand, Hat and Misc.
Misc slot can be equip with weapons or storage items!
If you right-click to your crow with a dye you can add a colored bandanna!
ftbquests.chapter.hexerei.quest493985000: Brushes are one of the most important attachments, as they allow the broom to fly.
Eventually the brush will be damaged, and will break.
&8All brushes can be enchanted by the way.
ftbquests.chapter.hexerei.quest507267707: Unlike the candles, Candelabras wont go out on their own.
They can be placed on top of a block, or under a block. Including chains and more.
ftbquests.chapter.hexerei.quest518967744: The candles are a dyeable, decorative block which can be used for lightning or magic.

Questlines belong to me, and is protected by all rights reserved. Do not try to steal without an explicit permission from me.
You can get power from kinetic motion aswell.
The Kinetic Dynamo generates power from the flow of water or the speed of the wind.
This machine allows for continuous, automated Steel output.
The Crusher multiblock from Immersive Engineering lets us crush materials on a larger scale.
It breaks items down, sometimes producing materials we couldn’t get before
The Industrial Squeezer is used to extra oil from seeds.
It can also be used to squeeze Coke Dust into Graphite Dust.
With electricity available, we can add Blast Furnace Preheaters to boost our Improved Blast Furnace.
Set it up, supply the materials, and it will craft the recipes you’ve assigned automatically.
This the Lightning Rod, we can harness this power and generate energy from it.
The lightning will strike the rod and generate power.
Steel fences can be used to increase the height of the rod.
The Fermenter multiblock is used to produce Ethanol.
Ethanol can be made from various crops and used to create other resources
Now we can dive into the mod!
Applying Creosote Oil to regular planks gives us access to Treated Planks. Treated Planks are used to make higher end equipment and machinery. We want to keep a steady supply of these.
&7I don't really know the mod btw, so here's a tutorial video.
The Sawmill cuts logs into planks faster than the Create saw.
It also produces Sawdust, which can be used to make cardboard boxes.
Connecting Water Wheels to a Kinetic Dynamo lets you passively generate power from flowing water.
Make sure the water isn’t flowing against parts of the wheel it shouldn’t, or it will slow down the rotation.
With Biodiesel ready, we can build a Diesel Generator to produce much more power.
This is one of our first major steps toward large-scale power production.
A large, slow, and powerful machine that can dig through the earth with ease. Shift and space to go up and down.
With Coke Dust ready, we can start building a Coke Oven. It takes some time to make, but it lets us produce Coal Coke and Creosote.
Building a Blast Furnace lets you use the Coal Coke we’ve been producing to superheat Iron into Steel.
It also creates Slag as a byproduct!

A primitive submarine — small, agile, and ideal for underwater exploration. Powered by a conduit, it has unlimited air and can be upgraded with various modules. Press H (default) to highlight entities with its built-in sonar.
LV, MV, and HV Accumulators&r are a compact way to store power.
Use the Engineer’s Hammer to configure their input and output sides.
With a Metal Press, you can use electricity to create plates, rods, and wires.
It’s faster and more automatable than the Create Press.
This book is a life saver if you are confused!
It shows tons of information about multi-block structures and more.
A small and primitive redstone contraption for automating farms. It detects grass and plants in its proximity and harvests them. When idle or out of fuel, it returns to its home position.
The Arc Furnace provides us with a simpiler way to be able to produce HOP Graphite without having to loose so many resources.
It also opens up the ability to begin processing all of the Osmium we had been gathering.
You can make Rough Rods with a Metal Press, or get the recipe from a trader to craft them in an Engineer’s Table.
The main tool in Immersive Engineering is the Engineer’s Hammer. It’s used to rotate machines and assemble multiblock structures.
With the Refinery, we can create new resources by refining what we already have.
Combine Ethanol and Plant Oil to make Biodiesel for power generation.
You can also produce Phenolic Resin, which is needed for other materials later on.
You can harness wind power using Windmills connected to a Kinetic Dynamo.
Simply place a Windmill on the Dynamo, and the wind will generate power automatically.
Windmill Sails improve the efficiency of your windmills.
Attach them to a windmill to generate more energy from the wind.
The Mixer is used to create Redstone Acid, which is essential for progressing in Mekanism.
It can also combine experience with mob drops to produce Mob Essence for crafting special resources.

A drone built from a modified quadcopter can carry items automatically. Mark one or more blocks as input and output, then let it go. You can also set an item filter to prevent unwanted items from spreading through your factory.
The Thermoelectric Generator produces power from heat differences.
Just place different heat blocks around it and the energy will start flowing.
Check your Engineer’s Manual for details on how much each block contributes.
Building and designing the same thing repeatedly can be frustrating — that’s where Schematicannon comes in.
The Bottling Machine is essential for producing advanced resources.
Phenolic Resin can be turned into Duroplast and Grinding Disks.
It can also create Redstone Acid Dusts.
Excavators are machines that gather resources from the world.
They work chunk by chunk, digging and collecting materials until the resources in the area are fully depleted.

ftbquests.chapter.introducing.quest87407: &fFTB Essentials is a useful utility mod that will make your overall gameplay easier and less suffering.
-&8/invsee <player> - Allows to view and edit other player inventories-
-&8/nickfor <player> <name…> - Changes nickname for another player in chat-
-&8/teleport_last <player> - Teleports to last known player location-
-&8/back - Teleports to previous location. Can be used multiple times-
-&8/rtp - Teleports you to random location in world, tries to find a non-ocean, safe place to land-
-&8/tpahere <player> - Requests player to teleport to you-
-&8/tpaccept <id> - Accepts request (will have a button for it on screen)-
-&8/tpadeny <id> - Denies request (will have a button for it on screen)-
-&8/kickme - Kicks yourself from server (in case the bed bug ever returns)-
-&8/trashcan - Opens an inventory where items get deleted when placed in and closed-
-&8/hat - Puts item currently in main hand in helmet slot making it your 'hat'-
-&8/heal - Heals player to full HP and food bar-

ftbquests.chapter.modular_routers.quest1: Gives the router an internal energy buffer.
This augment allows for precise control over how many items may be sent to or pulled from an inventory, or the router's buffer.

When a module has a Regulator Augment, you will see an extra numeric textfield in its graphical user interface (GUI) where you can configure a limit. This limit is interpreted differently depending on the particular module:

For the Sender Mk1/Mk2/Mk3 Modules and the Player Module (in insert mode), the module will only send an item to the inventory if there are fewer than the configured number of that item already present.
For the Puller Mk1/Mk2 and Player Module (in extract mode), the module will only pull an item from the inventory if there are more than the configured number of that item in the inventory.
&8[Click to read]

This powerful module acts like a fake player which can use an item in the router's buffer, against nearby blocks or entities. There are three modes, which can be selected via the controls on the right of the GUI.
Here's a list of the modes:
&eRight-Click:

This mode performs a right-click with the item in the router's buffer, just as if a player had done so. The logic used is the same as for player clicks, e.g. right-clicking a Flint and Steel on a door will open the door, not start a fire.
&eRight-Click Entity:
Right-click Entity This mode performs a Right-Click with the item in the router's buffer on a nearby entity. You could use this to milk a cow for example, or shear a sheep.
&eAttack Entity:
This mode performs a left-click with the item in the router's buffer on a nearby entity, attacking it. This mode costs Forge Energy by default, unlike other modules.
&8[Click to read]
This augment can be added to any module that has a range, such as the Sender Mk1/Mk2, Puller Mk1/Mk2, Extruder Mk1/Mk2, Fluid Mk2, and Vacuum modules.
It can be stacked, and each augment will reduce the range of the module by one block. This is probably only useful in conjunction with the Vacuum Module to control the range it scans for items.
&8[Click to read]
This augment can only be added to a Vacuum Module.

When this augment is installed, the Vacuum Module will absorb experience orbs instead of items. The orbs will be converted into Bottles o' Enchanting at a rate of 7 XP per bottle. This rate corresponds to the average amount of XP gained by breaking a Bottle o' Enchanting.

Depending on what other mods are installed, it might also be possible to convert orbs into XP fluids. This requires either a fluid-containing tank to be in the router's buffer or adjacent to the router. In the latter case, ensure that the Eject button is enabled in the Vacuum Module's graphical user interface (GUI).
&8[Click to read]
This augment can be added to any module.

Normally, modules are run when the router runs, with no questions asked. However, if this augment is added to a module, that module can define its own redstone behavior. An extra button is added to the module's graphical user interface (GUI) to control this setting.
&8[Click to read]
ftbquests.chapter.modular_routers.quest2: Modular Router is going to be the core of your whole modular router system. but it won't work out of the box, we need modules to make it work.
Let's start with the basic ones.
Put it in the modular router
This module extends and withdraws a row of blocks (from the router's buffer) in the module's configured direction.
Using this module, its possible to build large extending bridges and doorways.

This upgrade is used to guarantee that two or morerouters run at the same time. The Sync Upgrade has a tuning value of 0 .. 19 (i.e. 1 less than the base router tick rate of 20). This tuning value can be set by right-clicking the Sync Upgrade to open its GUI, or quickly set to a random value by sneak-right-clicking the upgrade.

Any routers with this upgrade installed, with same the tuning value, and with the same number of Speed Upgrades installed, will always run on the same tick. The actual tuning value doesn't matter; only that the value is consistent across the routers you want to synchronise.
This is particularly useful if you have a group of routers with Extruder Modules installed, and want to ensure all modules extend/retract at exactly the same time.
Disguise your router as a another block.
This augment can only be added to the Extruder Module Mk2.
When present, any fake blocks extruded by the module take on the properties of the faked block, e.g. Obsidian is hard to break, Glowstone emits light, and Redstone Blocks emit a redstone signal.
ftbquests.chapter.modular_routers.quest3: Modules in a router operate on a single item at a time: e.g. a Sender Module will send a single item from the router's buffer each router tick, regardless of how many items are in the buffer.

By adding Stack Upgrades to a router, this can be increased. Each Stack Upgrade doubles the number of items that can be processed by each module, up to a maximum of 64, or the item's native stack size (e.g. 16 for Ender Pearls).
It therefore follows that 6 is the maximum number of useful Stack Upgrades which can be installed in one router.
Modular routers mod offers HUGE amount of modules that can make your storage system even cleaner, and better!
ftbquests.chapter.modular_routers.quest4: Last tier of sender module, can transfer items up to INFINITE amount of range!
Can send items to multiple targets, pretty much a extended version of sender mk.2

This module behaves like the Dropper Module, except that it also imparts a configurable velocity to the dropped item, potentially throwing the item a considerable distance. You can ad just the item's speed, pitch and yaw via the module's GUI.
This module tries to break blocks..
This augment can only be applied to the Extruder Mk1 and Extruder Mk2 modules.
It can be stacked. Each instance of the augment increases the force with which entities are shoved when the module extrudes a block.
This augment can be added to any module that handles items (as opposed to blocks, fluids, or energy).

Adding Stack Augments to a module increases the number of items it can process per tick. Each Stack Augment doubles the number of items, up to a maximum of the item's natural stack size (which is 64 for most items).

If the router also has Stack Upgrades installed, the module's Stack Augments will override that setting. For example, if a router has 6 Stack Upgrades, and a module has 2 Stack Augments, the module will process 4 items per tick, not 64.
Put it in the modular router
ftbquests.chapter.modular_routers.quest5: By default, a router ticks every 20 server ticks, or once per second. On each tick, every installed module is executed in order, left to right.
If you need a router to run faster than this, add Speed Upgrades; each Speed Upgrade reduces the tick interval by 2 server ticks, down to aminimum of every 2 server ticks (or 10 times per second).

A Router with a Security Upgrade installed can only be  opened by players whitelisted by that upgrade. The upgrade doesn't prevent a router being broken; but since upgrades and modules remain in a broken router, players can't break a router to steal modules/upgrades or reconfigure the router. If you want to prevent a router being broken, you may wish to explore other mods' block protection capabilities.

Several modules (Placer, Breaker, Activator) do their work as a fake player. By default this is a player with the username [Modular Routers], but when a security upgrade is installed, those modules operate as the upgrade's owner. This is much safer on multiplayer servers with claim protection than simply allowing [Modular Routers] to do anything with your claims.

When the Activator Module is in Attack Mode, it will ignore any players whitelisted by a Security Upgrade installed in the Router. This is generally a good idea to avoid pain \& suffering if you have a high-damage weapon in your Router.
This module behaves somewhat like the Extruder Module Mk1, but with a few important differences:
The Mk2 module doesn't place items from the router's buffer, but rather from a template defined within the module itself.
This template appears on the right-hand side of the module's GUI, has 9 slots, and can have multiple items per slot. Items placed in the template are "ghost items.
Blocks extruded are "virtual" - effectively created out of nowhere, but drop nothing when broken and can't be crafted normally.
Therefore, this module isn't suitable for farming like the Extruder Mk1, but can be used to place doors/bridges etc. with more complex patterns than the Mk1 could.
The default range for the Extruder Mk2 is 24 blocks, which can be increased to 48 with Range Upgrades.
Unlike the Mk.1, the Mk.2 puller requires a right-click to select the target container for item transfer.
Second tier of sender, can send items up to 24 blocks.
Makes the router immune to explosion.
ftbquests.chapter.modular_routers.quest6: This module doesn't actually manipulate items, but instead detects specific items in the router's buffer. If the buffer contents are matched by the module's filter, it will make the router emit a redstone signal in the configured direction.
Unlike the Mk.1, the Mk.2 puller requires a right-click to specify the target storage for item extraction.
Latest tier of puller, can pull from 12 blocks away.
This module tries to transfer items between the router and a player's own inventory. The player can be anywhere in any dimension, making this a rather powerful module.
The module can transfer items either from or to the player; you can set this in the module's GUI.

The module can operate on either the player's main 36- slot inventory, their 4-slot armor inventory, their offhand slot, or their Ender inventory (as shown by vanilla Ender Chests). This can also be set in the module's GUI.
Extracted/inserted items can, of course, be filtered by the module.

This augment can only be added to the Vacuum Module. It allows the Vacuum Module to ignore the normal pickup delay on dropped items - 40 ticks for items dropped by players, and 10 ticks for items dropped by other means (e.g. sheep shearing) - and pick up items as soon as it sees them.
A max of one Fast Pickup Augment can be added.
Upgrades are huge QoL mechanics, i heavily suggest you to use them!
ftbquests.chapter.modular_routers.quest7: This augment can be added to any module that has a range, including the Sender Mk1/Mk2, Puller Mk1/Mk2, Extruder Mk1/Mk2, Fluid Mk2, and Vacuum modules.
It can be stacked, and each augment will increase the range of the module by one block.
&eSender&r sends items to a another storage method, always has more range than puller.
&ePuller&r has short range, pulls items from the storage and sends it to sender.
Remember these are only mk.1 in other module tiers they get really op quickly.
ftbquests.chapter.modular_routers.quest8: In order to set up your modular router system, you have to configure your modules.

While they're &ein the modular router,&r Middle-Click your modules. This will open a another GUI showing you where to extract the item to. Choose the direction your storage is facing and it will Pull \& Send.
Sender mk.1 works up to 8 blocks of range, so just keep the direction correct.
aaandd congratulations, you have set your first modular routers system up!
&8More information:

&8There are nine filter slots, where you can insert ghost copies of any item or block. The module will only operate if the item in the router's buffer matches an item in the module's filter (if whitelisting; the opposite if blacklisting).
{image:modularrouters:textures/patchouli/module_gui.png width:100 height:100 align:center}
&8[Click to read]
okay
Setting up your first system
This module is like a combination of an Energy Output and a Distributor Module, in that it can wirelessly distribute FE (Forge Energy) to up to 8 nearby energy-accepting blocks.
&8[Click to read]
This augment can only be added to the Dropper and Flinger modules.

It can be stacked; each augment added will increase the pickup delay on dropped/flung items by 10 ticks (0.5 sec). This can be useful if you don't want players accidentally picking up nearby dropped items, for example.
&8[Click to read]

This module tries to place an item from the router's buffer as a block, adjacent to the router in the module's configured direction. If the item isn't a block or the destination block space is obstructed, nothing will be done.
Normal Minecraft placement rules are followed; e.g. sugar cane can only be placed next to water on sand/dirt.
Fluid blocks will be replaced, as will replaceable blocks such as tall grass.
The Placer module can plant seeds on farmland, and cocoa beans on an adjacent jungle log.
&8[Click to read]

This module attempts to output FE (Forge Energy) from the Router to an adjacent energy- receiving block, in its configured direction. The module can extract energy from either the router's internal energy buffer (if any Energy Upgrades are installed) or from an energy-containing item in the router's item buffer. The internal energy buffer is used by preference.
&8[Click to read]
This module scans for dropped items in a 13x13x13 cubic area around the router (i.e. up to 6 blocks in each direction), and absorbs them into the router's buffer, if possible.
&8[Click to read]

This module tries to drop an item from the router's buffer as an item entity in the world. The drop will be ad jacent to the router in the module's configured direction. The item entity will be placed with a zero velocity, unlike the vanilla Dropper which adds an irritating random velocity to the item.
&8[Click to read]
ftbquests.chapter.modular_routers.quest9: This dangerous module permanently destroys items in the router's buffer!
It is strongly recommended to configure this module with a whitelist filter to prevent accidental deletion of valuable items.

ftbquests.chapter.powah.quest16316487520: The solar panel is the lowest energy generator alongside the thermo generator, but its pretty simple to set up. Place the panel in an open space and it will generate power as long as its day and its not obstructed by any block.
ftbquests.chapter.powah.quest21895327526: The energizing rod is used to power the orb by being placed near it, and you can also use multiple of them. It requires a power source so make sure its connected to a power generation system.
I recommend making at least 2-3 for faster crafting speed.
You can use the wrench to configure the rod to power a specific orb if there are multiple ones next to each other.
ftbquests.chapter.powah.quest22420879737: The Binding Card can be binded to a player by right-clicking with it in your hand. This can be placed in the Player Transmitter to power any item or equipment in your inventory, as long as you are in the same dimension as the transmitter.
ftbquests.chapter.powah.quest29629672414: The power of thunder, in your hands.
ftbquests.chapter.powah.quest35965976507: The Player Transmitter is used to charge the player's equipment and items wirelessly. This can be done by connecting the transmitter to a power source, and putting a Binding Card inside it.
ftbquests.chapter.powah.quest41931975310: The magmator generates power using lava. Make sure you have a stable supply.
ftbquests.chapter.powah.quest47112537873: The Reactor is a multiblock and the best power generator that this mod has to offer. You will require 36 reactor blocks to build it, and this is automatic. Place one block where you want it to be built, then right click it with the blocks in your main hand. This will build the multiblock in a 3x4 area, so make sure its clear.

The fuel used to power the reactor is Uraninite, and nothing else. The reactor can also be augmented using redstone and coal in their designated slots. Doing this will make the heat rise, which will increase the fuel consumption, alonside power generation. To cool it down you will require a coolant, which can be liquid or solid. This means ice blocks and/or a water source. For specific values and more information check the &nManual&r.
ftbquests.chapter.powah.quest49840204961: By using a photoelectric pane on an enderman or endermite, you can obtain the Lens of Ender. This can be used on a solar panel to make it generate power even through blocks.
ftbquests.chapter.powah.quest50179308748: Used to pick up, config and rotate Powah blocks and cables.
ftbquests.chapter.powah.quest50859032188: The Manual has all of the information you need about the blocks and items of this mod, so if you ever need a quick look at what something does or its stats, check it!
ftbquests.chapter.powah.quest52193594272: The thermo generator is a pretty interesting one. It requires water input to cool down and function, as well as a heat source under it. This can be a magma block or lava. Electricity output depends on the heat source used, lava being the highest one.
ftbquests.chapter.powah.quest55202003586: The Energy Discharger is used to drain the power from items put inside it and store it in an internal buffer, which then can be transferred or stored. This works only with Batteries or Cells.
ftbquests.chapter.powah.quest55982699476: Just energy cables. Configurable using the &nWrench&r.
ftbquests.chapter.powah.quest56775164265: Using the newly created dielectric paste and quite a bit of iron, we can finally make the first materials required to get into this mod.
ftbquests.chapter.powah.quest57900691088: The first step in creating your first &ePowah &fgenerator is making some &ndielectric paste&r. This does require you to get to the nether, so put your fireproof pants on and go slaying!
Dielectric paste will also be required in almost all recipes, so make sure you stock well on this.
ftbquests.chapter.powah.quest60759192823: The furnator uses fuel like coal to generate power.
ftbquests.chapter.powah.quest62741253921: The Energy Hopper can charge all the items in the chest or block with an inventory that its connected to, when supplied with power. This works only on Batteries or Cells.
ftbquests.chapter.powah.quest64980943297: &ePowah&r is a mod that adds high &benergy &fgeneration options, including a multiblock, as well as a wireless way to transport said energy. Yes, thats right, &lwireless transfer &rof energy which does not have a range limit at all!
It also introduces a way to wirelessly charge all your equipment and items, even across dimensions, for as long as your power source does not run out.
This questline will guide you through all you need to know about this mod, so make sure you check it regularly.
&8This questline was made by &e@peakmancer&r &8in our discord server, thanks for his amazing work!
ftbquests.chapter.powah.quest67493008509: Uraninite is an ore that can be found underground at y level 64 or lower. Its found in small veins but the mined amount can be increased using Fortune.
ftbquests.chapter.powah.quest72113031014: This is the "crafting bench" you will use to progress through this mod. Be warned, higher tier materials will require more power to craft, which can get very high very fast. Check JEI or manual for values.
You can automate the orb, although it can be a bit tricky. For an in-depth tutorial check the links below.
ftbquests.chapter.powah.quest84536142475: Ender Cells are the highlight of this mod, alongside Ender Gates.
Store energy inside and use it wirelessly using ender gates, anywhere!
Capacity is increased by adding Batteries which get consumed.
Make sure that power is being stored inside the right channel, and that the gates are set to the right channel as well.
ftbquests.chapter.powah.quest85975535152: Can store and carry energy, which will charge equipment and items as long as its in your inventory. When added to an Ender Cell it will get consumed and increase the cell's capacity. Any power stored in the battery will get added to the network once consumed.
Be careful which channel you add the Batteries to in the Ender Cell. This action cannot be reversed.
ftbquests.chapter.powah.quest88385992261: The Ender Gates transfer power from the Ender Cell network. Wirelessly! Just stick them to the machine or cable you want to power and make sure its set to the right channel. Don't forget you need power inside the Ender Cell to be able to transfer it ;). Higher tiers transfer power faster.
ftbquests.chapter.powah.quest88659866504: The Dimensional Binding Card allows charging across dimensions. Obtained by right-clicking an Enderman or Endermite with a binding card.
ftbquests.chapter.powah.quest89117844799: Basic energy storage. To not be confused with the Ender Cell.

ftbquests.chapter.progress.quest66610092: To craft Ankh's Tablet, you will first require the Tinkerer's Accessory Template. Here is how to create it:
You must first obtain Spirits, which are dropped by vanilla mobs such as Zombie, Slime, and Skeleton. Note that each mob drops a different type of Spirit.

Copper Pipes are rudimentary and don't include any filtering or pathing for items. The way items flow in pipes is based in a small set of rules:
&6&oApply the following rules in order&r&r
1. Items will move down if possible.
2. Items will move forward if possible.
3. At an intersection, items will randomly flow left or right.
4. Items will not go upwards unless that's the only possibility.
5. Items attempting to enter a full container will bounce back (Items bouncing back from pipes remember which direction they came into the pipe, and will avoid that direction).
6. Items will not flow into disabled (powered) pipes.
